discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correction --> B), mistakenly choose C) below

Selected Answer: C
Answer: B) - XXE = eXternal XML Entity = injecting executable parts into XML structures (SOAP / Web Services, etc..)

questions.question_text:
Which of the following web vulnerabilities would an attacker be attempting to exploit if they delivered the following input?
//IMG//
What useful information is gathered during a successful Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) enumeration?

choices.A: A list of all mail proxy server addresses used by the targeted host.
choices.D: Reveals the daily outgoing message limits before mailboxes are locked.
choices.C: The two internal commands VRFY and EXPN provide a confirmation of valid users, email addresses, aliases, and mailing lists.
choices.B: The internal command RCPT provides a list of ports open to message traffic.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C

There are capabilities in SMTP which can be used to enumerate users or at least email addresses:

 EXPN command – available in ESMTP, used to expand mailing lists – i. e. when you find such address, try it with this command
• Whether this command is supported can be found in EHLO response.

 VRFY command – verify users, but not all servers has this feature enabled.
• Postfix server has VRFY enabled by default:
o Status code 250 = success, 
o Status code 252 = address can’t be verified but server will attempt to deliver the message.

questions.question_text: When considering how an attacker may exploit a web server, what is web server footprinting?

choices.C: When an attacker implements a vulnerability scanner to identity weaknesses
choices.A: When an attacker creates a complete profile of the site's external links and file structures
choices.B: When an attacker uses a brute-force attack to crack a web-server password
choices.D: When an attacker gathers system-level data, including account details and server names

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. When an attacker creates a complete profile of the site's external links and file structures

Explanation:
Web server footprinting refers to the process of gathering information about a target web server in order to map out its structure and identify potential attack vectors. This includes discovering publicly available data about the server's external links, file structures, and other resources.

Attackers use footprinting techniques to learn about the target's architecture and potentially vulnerable entry points. This may include identifying exposed directories, files, technologies in use, and links that could be exploited for a security breach.

choices.C: Flooding the web server with requests to perform a DoS attack
choices.A: Performing content enumeration on the web server to discover hidden folders
choices.D: Downloading all the contents of the web page locally for further examination
choices.B: Using wget to perform banner grabbing on the webserver

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer: B

Wget:
-S --server-response 
Print the headers sent by HTTP servers and responses sent by FTP servers. 

-q --quiet 
Turn off Wget's output.

questions.question_text: What would be the purpose of running "wget 192.168.0.15 -q -S" against a web server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C) - Linux

The common default TTL values are:
• 64 – Linux/MAC OSX systems
• 128 – Windows systems
• 255 – Network devices like routers

https://www.imperva.com/learn/performance/time-to-live-ttl/

A default TCP window size of 5840 bytes is historically associated with Linux-based operating systems (older kernels), specifically:
• Linux 2.4.x and some early Linux 2.6.x kernels
• Also seen in embedded Linux devices, such as routers or IoT gear based on older kernels

Why 5840 Bytes?
• The value 5840 bytes is intentionally chosen to fit within a 1460-byte MSS (Maximum Segment Size) without IP or TCP options.
• This was a default TCP receive window that Linux used before dynamic window scaling became more common.
• Modern Linux kernels typically negotiate higher window sizes using TCP window scaling (RFC 1323).

Selected Answer: A
The TTL (Time to Live) and the TCP window size can be used to help identify the operating system of a target machine, as different OSes tend to set these values in specific ways.

 - TTL: 64: The TTL value of 64 is commonly associated with Linux or Mac OS. Both of these operating systems often use 64 as the default TTL value for outgoing packets.
 - Window Size: 5840: The TCP window size is another key indicator. A window size of 5840 is typical of Windows OS, as it generally uses values that are in this range.

However, considering both the TTL and the window size together:
 - A TTL of 64 combined with a window size of 5840 strongly suggests Windows OS.

In summary, based on the TTL value and window size, the target machine is most likely running Windows OS.

questions.question_text:
Harris is attempting to identify the OS running on his target machine. He inspected the initial TTL in the IP header and the related TCP window size and obtained the following results:

TTL: 64 -

Window Size: 5840 -
What the OS running on the target machine?
